ovdesc.p: This table allows the user to identify the brokers that the bank authorises its dealers to deal through. Rates applicable for each type of transaction the broker deals in can be defined for automatic calculation purposes during deal input stages.

During the deal input stages for Money Market, Loans and Deposits, and Future Rate Agreement contracts, if a broker code is entered then details from this file are obtained in order to calculate the brokerage amount (if no amount is entered by the user), and to determine the transaction code to credit the brokerage amount to.

desc.p: Identifies the transaction code to be used for credit entries to the broker's account.
This transaction code is used when a match is found for the type of deal specified in the fields SYSTEM.ID to CURRENCY.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.

The set of fields SYSTEM.ID to TXN.CODE are used to determine different brokerage rates applicable to specific deal types. If one is not found and no default value exists (i.e. a multivalue group that has all match parameters blank), then no automatic calculation can be performed and the user will be required to enter a manual amount.

This field holds the customer account number where the BROKER wishes funds to be paid for the currency defined in the related CCY.FOR.PAYMENT field. The account defined in this field must be an account on the T24 system, for the currency defined in the related field and must belong to the BROKER.
The account cannot be a NOSTRO account.
If no account is defined in this field then an internal account number will be used. This internal account number is defined as:
[CCY][Broker Category][Broker Sub Div]
Where:
CCY - the broker currency as defined on the contract.
Broker Category - the category defined on the ACCOUNT.CLASS record BROKER.
Broker Sub Div - 4 digit subdivision code.
Fields CCY.FOR.PAYMENT and PAYMENT.ACCOUNT form a related multi value set.
Standard account format relating to a customer account.
The account specified must be for the currency defined in the related CCY.FOR.PAYMENT field.
The account specified must belong to the BROKER.

The set of fields SYSTEM.ID to TXN.CODE are used to determine different brokerage rates applicable to specific deal types. The parameters system id, category code, term, currency and customer type are taken from the deal at input stage and a match is located within this record. If one is found then that rate can be used for automatic brokerage calculations. If one is not found and no default value exists (ie. a multivalue group that has all match parameters blank), then no automatic calculation can be performed and the user will be required to enter a manual amount.

The term from the deal is defined as the number of days from the value date to the maturity date. This figure is extracted at deal input time and is used to find a match here. The values in this field should be defined incrementally, i.e. 0D for call/notice deals, 7D, 1M, 3M, 6M, 1Y, etc.
If no value is entered here then all terms will match successfully.
In the format:
[N][TYPE] where N can be 1-3 numeric digits and TYPE can be either 'D' - Days, 'M' - Months or 'Y' - Years.
(Optional Input)
Multivalue field associated with fields SYSTEM.ID to TXN.CODE.
This field defines whether the brokerage calculation will be carried out on either a FIXED basis, a PERIOD basis or a PRESENT.VALUE basis.
For the FIXED basis the brokerage calculated igonres the period of the contract and returns an amount based solely on the contract principal.

Example: A loan matches a deal type defined on the BROKER record which will use the FIXED basis. The principal on the contract is 1,000 GBP. If the percentage rate for the deal type is set at 1% and the broker currency set to GBP the resulting brokerage amount will be 100 GBP.

For the PERIOD basis the length of the contract is used in the calculation of the brokerage amount. The unit period for calculation (360 or 365 days) is based on the default basis of the contract currency.

Example: A deposit matches a deal type defined on the BROKER record which will use the PERIOD basis. The principal on the contract is 10,000 GBP for a period of two years. If the percentage rate for the deal type is set at 1% the resulting brokerage amount will be 10 GBP for each year, for a total of 200 GBP.

N.B. Unless FIXED is specified on this record for the deal type defined for the sub value group, the calculation uses the PERIOD basis, except for brokerage taken on Letter of Credit Drawings, the FIXED basis is always used regardless of contents of this field.
For PRESENT.VALUE the PV formula will be used in the brokerage calculation.
The PRESENT.VALUE calc.type is primarily for the brokerage calculation of the interest rate swap contracts.

For Example: An IRS of GBP 10M with Bank A paying 6.72% fixed semi-annually and receiving floating from Bank B. Value date is 03 Apr 1998 and maturity date is 03 Apr 2002. With brokerage rate set to 0.01% and applying the above formula, the brokerage will be calculated as GBP 3,457.15.
Must either be FIXED, PERIOD or PRESENT.VALUE.
